  16. open Parsetree
  17. module String = Misc.Stdlib.String

  19. let ppf = Format.err_formatter
  20. (* Print the dependencies *)

  22. type file_kind = ML | MLI

  24. let load_path = ref ([] : (string * string array) list)
  25. let ml_synonyms = ref [".ml"]
  26. let mli_synonyms = ref [".mli"]
  27. let shared = ref false
  28. let native_only = ref false
  29. let bytecode_only = ref false
  30. let raw_dependencies = ref false
  31. let sort_files = ref false
  32. let all_dependencies = ref false
  33. let nocwd = ref false
  34. let one_line = ref false
  35. let files =
  36.   ref ([] : (string * file_kind * String.Set.t * string list) list)
  37. let allow_approximation = ref false
  38. let map_files = ref []
  39. let module_map = ref String.Map.empty
  40. let debug = ref false

  42. module Error_occurred : sig
  43.   val set : unit -> unit
  44.   val get : unit -> bool
  45. end = struct
  46.   (* Once set to [true], [error_occurred] should never be set to
  47.      [false]. *)
  48. ‌  let error_occurred = ref false
  49. ‌  let get () = !error_occurred
  50. ‌  let set () = error_occurred := true
  51. end

  53. (* Fix path to use '/' as directory separator instead of '\'.
  54.    Only under Windows. *)

  56. ‌let fix_slash s =
  57.   if Sys.os_type = "Unix" then s else begin
  58.     String.map (function '\\' -> '/' | c -> c) s
  59.   end

  61. (* Since we reinitialize load_path after reading OCAMLCOMP,
  62.   we must use a cache instead of calling Sys.readdir too often. *)
  63. let dirs = ref String.Map.empty
  64. let readdir dir =
  65.   try
  66.     String.Map.find dir !dirs
  67.   with Not_found ->
  68.     let contents =
  69.       try
  70.         Sys.readdir dir
  71.       with Sys_error msg ->
  72.         Format.fprintf Format.err_formatter "@[Bad -I option: %s@]@." msg;
  73.         Error_occurred.set ();
  74.         [||]
  75.     in
  76.     dirs := String.Map.add dir contents !dirs;
  77.     contents

  79. ‌let add_to_list li s =
  80.   li := s :: !li

  82. ‌let add_to_load_path dir =
  83.   try
  84.     let dir = Misc.expand_directory Config.standard_library dir in
  85.     let contents = readdir dir in
  86.     add_to_list load_path (dir, contents)
  87.   with Sys_error msg ->
  88.     Format.fprintf Format.err_formatter "@[Bad -I option: %s@]@." msg;
  89.     Error_occurred.set ()

  91. ‌let add_to_synonym_list synonyms suffix =
  92.   if (String.length suffix) > 1 && suffix.[0] = '.' then
  93.     add_to_list synonyms suffix
  94.   else begin
  95.     Format.fprintf Format.err_formatter "@[Bad suffix: '%s'@]@." suffix;
  96.     Error_occurred.set ()
  97.   end

  99. (* Find file 'name' (capitalized) in search path *)
  100. let find_module_in_load_path name =
  101.   let names = List.map (fun ext -> name ^ ext) (!mli_synonyms @ !ml_synonyms) in
  102.   let unames =
  103.     let uname = String.uncapitalize_ascii name in
  104.     List.map (fun ext -> uname ^ ext) (!mli_synonyms @ !ml_synonyms)
  105.   in
  106.   let rec find_in_array a pos =
  107.     if pos >= Array.length a then None else begin
  108.       let s = a.(pos) in
  109.       if List.mem s names || List.mem s unames then
  110.         Some s
  111.       else
  112.         find_in_array a (pos + 1)
  113.     end in
  114. ‌  let rec find_in_path = function
  115.     [] -> raise Not_found
  116.   | (dir, contents) :: rem ->
  117.       match find_in_array contents 0 with
  118.         Some truename ->
  119.           if dir = "." then truename else Filename.concat dir truename
  120.       | None -> find_in_path rem in
  121.   find_in_path !load_path

  123. ‌let find_dependency target_kind modname (byt_deps, opt_deps) =
  124.   try
  125.     let filename = find_module_in_load_path modname in
  126.     let basename = Filename.chop_extension filename in
  127.     let cmi_file = basename ^ ".cmi" in
  128.     let cmx_file = basename ^ ".cmx" in
  129.     let mli_exists =
  130.       List.exists (fun ext -> Sys.file_exists (basename ^ ext)) !mli_synonyms in
  131.     let ml_exists =
  132.       List.exists (fun ext -> Sys.file_exists (basename ^ ext)) !ml_synonyms in
  133.     if mli_exists then
  134.       let new_opt_dep =
  135.         if !all_dependencies then
  136.           match target_kind with
  137.           | MLI -> [ cmi_file ]
  138.           | ML  ->
  139.               cmi_file :: (if ml_exists then [ cmx_file ] else [])
  140.         else
  141.         (* this is a make-specific hack that makes .cmx to be a 'proxy'
  142.            target that would force the dependency on .cmi via transitivity *)
  143.         if ml_exists
  144.         then [ cmx_file ]
  145.         else [ cmi_file ]
  146.       in
  147.       ( cmi_file :: byt_deps, new_opt_dep @ opt_deps)
  148.     else
  149.       (* "just .ml" case *)
  150. ‌      let bytenames =
  151.         if !all_dependencies then
  152.           match target_kind with
  153.           | MLI -> [ cmi_file ]
  154.           | ML  -> [ cmi_file ]
  155.         else
  156.           (* again, make-specific hack *)
  157.           [basename ^ (if !native_only then ".cmx" else ".cmo")] in
  158. ‌      let optnames =
  159.         if !all_dependencies
  160.         then match target_kind with
  161.           | MLI -> [ cmi_file ]
  162.           | ML  -> [ cmi_file; cmx_file ]
  163.         else [ cmx_file ]
  164.       in
  165.       (bytenames @ byt_deps, optnames @  opt_deps)
  166.   with Not_found ->
  167.     (byt_deps, opt_deps)

  169. ‌let (depends_on, escaped_eol) = (":", " \\\n    ")

  171. ‌let print_filename s =
  172.   let s = if !Clflags.force_slash then fix_slash s else s in
  173.   if not (String.contains s ' ') then begin
  174.     print_string s;
  175.   end else begin
  176. ‌    let rec count n i =
  177.       if i >= String.length s then n
  178.       else if s.[i] = ' ' then count (n+1) (i+1)
  179.       else count n (i+1)
  180.     in
  181. ‌    let spaces = count 0 0 in
  182. ‌    let result = Bytes.create (String.length s + spaces) in
  183. ‌    let rec loop i j =
  184.       if i >= String.length s then ()
  185.       else if s.[i] = ' ' then begin
  186.         Bytes.set result j '\\';
  187.         Bytes.set result (j+1) ' ';
  188.         loop (i+1) (j+2);
  189.       end else begin
  190.         Bytes.set result j s.[i];
  191.         loop (i+1) (j+1);
  192.       end
  193.     in
  194.     loop 0 0;
  195.     print_bytes result;
  196.   end

  198. ‌let print_dependencies target_files deps =
  199.   let pos = ref 0 in
  200.   let print_on_same_line item =
  201.     if !pos <> 0 then print_string " ";
  202.     print_filename item;
  203.     pos := !pos + String.length item + 1;
  204.   in
  205. ‌  let print_on_new_line item =
  206.     print_string escaped_eol;
  207.     print_filename item;
  208.     pos := String.length item + 4;
  209.   in
  210. ‌  let print_compact item =
  211.     if !one_line || (!pos + 1 + String.length item <= 77)
  212.     then print_on_same_line item
  213.     else print_on_new_line item
  214.   in
  215. ‌  let print_dep item =
  216.     if !one_line
  217.     then print_on_same_line item
  218.     else print_on_new_line item
  219.   in
  220.   List.iter print_compact target_files;
  221.   print_string " "; print_string depends_on;
  222.   pos := !pos + String.length depends_on + 1;
  223.   List.iter print_dep deps;
  224.   print_string "\n"

  226. ‌let print_raw_dependencies source_file deps =
  227.   print_filename source_file; print_string depends_on;
  228.   String.Set.iter
  229.     (fun dep ->
  230.        (* filter out "*predef*" *)
  231.       if (String.length dep > 0)
  232.           && (match dep.[0] with
  233.               | 'A'..'Z' | '\128'..'\255' -> true
  234.               | _ -> false) then
  235.         begin
  236.           print_char ' ';
  237.           print_string dep
  238.         end)
  239.     deps;
  240.   print_char '\n'


  243. (* Process one file *)

  245. let print_exception exn =
  246.   Location.report_exception Format.err_formatter exn

  248. let report_err exn =
  249.   Error_occurred.set ();
  250.   print_exception exn

  252. let tool_name = "ocamldep"

  254. let rec lexical_approximation lexbuf =
  255.   (* Approximation when a file can't be parsed.
  256.      Heuristic:
  257.      - first component of any path starting with an uppercase character is a
  258.        dependency.
  259.      - always skip the token after a dot, unless dot is preceded by a
  260.        lower-case identifier
  261.      - always skip the token after a backquote
  262.   *)
  263.   try
  264.     let rec process after_lident lexbuf =
  265.       match Lexer.token lexbuf with
  266.       | Parser.UIDENT name ->
  267.           Depend.free_structure_names :=
  268.             String.Set.add name !Depend.free_structure_names;
  269.           process false lexbuf
  270.       | Parser.LIDENT _ -> process true lexbuf
  271.       | Parser.DOT when after_lident -> process false lexbuf
  272.       | Parser.DOT | Parser.BACKQUOTE -> skip_one lexbuf
  273.       | Parser.EOF -> ()
  274.       | _ -> process false lexbuf
  275.     and skip_one lexbuf =
  276.       match Lexer.token lexbuf with
  277.       | Parser.DOT | Parser.BACKQUOTE -> skip_one lexbuf
  278.       | Parser.EOF -> ()
  279.       | _ -> process false lexbuf

  281.     in
  282.     process false lexbuf
  283.   with Lexer.Error _ -> lexical_approximation lexbuf

  285. ‌let read_and_approximate inputfile =
  286.   Depend.free_structure_names := String.Set.empty;
  287.   let ic = open_in_bin inputfile in
  288.   try
  289.     seek_in ic 0;
  290.     Location.input_name := inputfile;
  291.     let lexbuf = Lexing.from_channel ic in
  292.     Location.init lexbuf inputfile;
  293.     lexical_approximation lexbuf;
  294.     close_in ic;
  295.     !Depend.free_structure_names
  296.   with exn ->
  297.     close_in ic;
  298.     report_err exn;
  299.     !Depend.free_structure_names

  301. ‌let read_parse_and_extract parse_function extract_function def ast_kind
  302.     source_file =
  303.   Depend.pp_deps := [];
  304.   Depend.free_structure_names := String.Set.empty;
  305.   try
  306.     let input_file = Pparse.preprocess source_file in
  307.     begin try
  308.       let ast = Pparse.file ~tool_name input_file parse_function ast_kind in
  309.       let bound_vars =
  310.         List.fold_left
  311.           (fun bv modname ->
  312.              let lid =
  313.                let lexbuf = Lexing.from_string modname in
  314.                Location.init lexbuf
  315.                  (Printf.sprintf "command line argument: -open %S" modname);
  316.                Parse.simple_module_path lexbuf in
  317.              Depend.open_module bv lid)
  318.           !module_map ((* PR#7248 *) List.rev !Clflags.open_modules)
  319.       in
  320.       let r = extract_function bound_vars ast in
  321.       Pparse.remove_preprocessed input_file;
  322.       (!Depend.free_structure_names, r)
  323.     with x ->
  324.       Pparse.remove_preprocessed input_file;
  325.       raise x
  326.     end
  327.   with x -> begin
  328.     print_exception x;
  329.     if not !allow_approximation then begin
  330.       Error_occurred.set ();
  331.       (String.Set.empty, def)
  332.     end else
  333.       (read_and_approximate source_file, def)
  334.   end

  336. ‌let print_ml_dependencies source_file extracted_deps pp_deps =
  337.   let basename = Filename.chop_extension source_file in
  338.   let byte_targets = [ basename ^ ".cmo" ] in
  339.   let native_targets =
  340.     if !all_dependencies
  341.     then [ basename ^ ".cmx"; basename ^ ".o" ]
  342.     else [ basename ^ ".cmx" ] in
  343. ‌  let shared_targets = [ basename ^ ".cmxs" ] in
  344. ‌  let init_deps = if !all_dependencies then [source_file] else [] in
  345. ‌  let cmi_name = basename ^ ".cmi" in
  346. ‌  let init_deps, extra_targets =
  347.     if List.exists (fun ext -> Sys.file_exists (basename ^ ext))
  348.         !mli_synonyms
  349.     then (cmi_name :: init_deps, cmi_name :: init_deps), []
  350.     else (init_deps, init_deps),
  351.          (if !all_dependencies then [cmi_name] else [])
  352.   in
  353. ‌  let (byt_deps, native_deps) =
  354.     String.Set.fold (find_dependency ML)
  355.       extracted_deps init_deps in
  356.   if not !native_only then
  357.     print_dependencies (byte_targets @ extra_targets) (byt_deps @ pp_deps);
  358.   if not !bytecode_only then
  359.     begin
  360.       print_dependencies (native_targets @ extra_targets)
  361.         (native_deps @ pp_deps);
  362.       if !shared then
  363.         print_dependencies (shared_targets @ extra_targets)
  364.           (native_deps @ pp_deps)
  365.     end

  367. ‌let print_mli_dependencies source_file extracted_deps pp_deps =
  368.   let basename = Filename.chop_extension source_file in
  369.   let (byt_deps, _opt_deps) =
  370.     String.Set.fold (find_dependency MLI)
  371.       extracted_deps ([], []) in
  372.   print_dependencies [basename ^ ".cmi"] (byt_deps @ pp_deps)

  374. ‌let print_file_dependencies (source_file, kind, extracted_deps, pp_deps) =
  375.   if !raw_dependencies then begin
  376.     print_raw_dependencies source_file extracted_deps
  377.   end else
  378.     match kind with
  379.     | ML -> print_ml_dependencies source_file extracted_deps pp_deps
  380.     | MLI -> print_mli_dependencies source_file extracted_deps pp_deps


  383. ‌let ml_file_dependencies source_file =
  384.   let parse_use_file_as_impl lexbuf =
  385.     let f x =
  386.       match x with
  387.       | Ptop_def s -> s
  388.       | Ptop_dir _ -> []
  389.     in
  390.     List.flatten (List.map f (Parse.use_file lexbuf))
  391.   in
  392.   let (extracted_deps, ()) =
  393.     read_parse_and_extract parse_use_file_as_impl Depend.add_implementation ()
  394.                            Pparse.Structure source_file
  395.   in
  396.   files := (source_file, ML, extracted_deps, !Depend.pp_deps) :: !files

  398. ‌let mli_file_dependencies source_file =
  399.   let (extracted_deps, ()) =
  400.     read_parse_and_extract Parse.interface Depend.add_signature ()
  401.                            Pparse.Signature source_file
  402.   in
  403.   files := (source_file, MLI, extracted_deps, !Depend.pp_deps) :: !files

  405. ‌let process_file_as process_fun def source_file =
  406.   Compenv.readenv ppf (Before_compile source_file);
  407.   load_path := [];
  408.   let cwd = if !nocwd then [] else [Filename.current_dir_name] in
  409.   List.iter add_to_load_path (
  410.       (!Compenv.last_include_dirs @
  411.        !Clflags.include_dirs @
  412.        !Compenv.first_include_dirs @
  413.        cwd
  414.       ));
  415.   Location.input_name := source_file;
  416.   try
  417.     if Sys.file_exists source_file then process_fun source_file else def
  418.   with x -> report_err x; def

  420. ‌let process_file source_file ~ml_file ~mli_file ~def =
  421.   if List.exists (Filename.check_suffix source_file) !ml_synonyms then
  422.     process_file_as ml_file def source_file
  423.   else if List.exists (Filename.check_suffix source_file) !mli_synonyms then
  424.     process_file_as mli_file def source_file
  425.   else def

  427. let file_dependencies source_file =
  428.   process_file source_file ~def:()
  429.     ~ml_file:ml_file_dependencies
  430.     ~mli_file:mli_file_dependencies

  432. let file_dependencies_as kind =
  433.   match kind with
  434.   | ML -> process_file_as ml_file_dependencies ()
  435.   | MLI -> process_file_as mli_file_dependencies ()

  437. ‌let sort_files_by_dependencies files =
  438.   let h = Hashtbl.create 31 in
  439.   let worklist = ref [] in

  441. (* Init Hashtbl with all defined modules *)
  442.   let files = List.map (fun (file, file_kind, deps, pp_deps) ->
  443.     let modname =
  444.       String.capitalize_ascii (Filename.chop_extension (Filename.basename file))
  445.     in
  446.     let key = (modname, file_kind) in
  447.     let new_deps = ref [] in
  448.     Hashtbl.add h key (file, new_deps);
  449.     worklist := key :: !worklist;
  450.     (modname, file_kind, deps, new_deps, pp_deps)
  451.   ) files in

  453. (* Keep only dependencies to defined modules *)
  454.   List.iter (fun (modname, file_kind, deps, new_deps, _pp_deps) ->
  455.     let add_dep modname kind =
  456.       new_deps := (modname, kind) :: !new_deps;
  457.     in
  458.     String.Set.iter (fun modname ->
  459.       match file_kind with
  460.           ML -> (* ML depends both on ML and MLI *)
  461.             if Hashtbl.mem h (modname, MLI) then add_dep modname MLI;
  462.             if Hashtbl.mem h (modname, ML) then add_dep modname ML
  463.         | MLI -> (* MLI depends on MLI if exists, or ML otherwise *)
  464.           if Hashtbl.mem h (modname, MLI) then add_dep modname MLI
  465.           else if Hashtbl.mem h (modname, ML) then add_dep modname ML
  466.     ) deps;
  467.     if file_kind = ML then (* add dep from .ml to .mli *)
  468.       if Hashtbl.mem h (modname, MLI) then add_dep modname MLI
  469.   ) files;

  471. (* Print and remove all files with no remaining dependency. Iterate
  472.    until all files have been removed (worklist is empty) or
  473.    no file was removed during a turn (cycle). *)
  474.   let printed = ref true in
  475.   while !printed && !worklist <> [] do
  476.     let files = !worklist in
  477.     worklist := [];
  478.     printed := false;
  479.     List.iter (fun key ->
  480.       let (file, deps) = Hashtbl.find h key in
  481.       let set = !deps in
  482.       deps := [];
  483.       List.iter (fun key ->
  484.         if Hashtbl.mem h key then deps := key :: !deps
  485.       ) set;
  486.       if !deps = [] then begin
  487.         printed := true;
  488.         Printf.printf "%s " file;
  489.         Hashtbl.remove h key;
  490.       end else
  491.         worklist := key :: !worklist
  492.     ) files
  493.   done;

  495.   if !worklist <> [] then begin
  496.     Location.error "cycle in dependencies. End of list is not sorted."
  497.     |> Location.print_report Format.err_formatter;
  498.     let sorted_deps =
  499.       let li = ref [] in
  500.       Hashtbl.iter (fun _ file_deps -> li := file_deps :: !li) h;
  501.       List.sort (fun (file1, _) (file2, _) -> String.compare file1 file2) !li
  502.     in
  503.     List.iter (fun (file, deps) ->
  504.       Format.fprintf Format.err_formatter "\t@[%s: " file;
  505.       List.iter (fun (modname, kind) ->
  506.         Format.fprintf Format.err_formatter "%s.%s " modname
  507.           (if kind=ML then "ml" else "mli");
  508.       ) !deps;
  509.       Format.fprintf Format.err_formatter "@]@.";
  510.       Printf.printf "%s " file) sorted_deps;
  511.     Error_occurred.set ()
  512.   end;
  513.   Printf.printf "\n%!";
  514.   ()

  516. (* Map *)

  518. let rec dump_map s0 ppf m =
  519.   let open Depend in
  520.   String.Map.iter
  521.     (fun key (Node(s1,m')) ->
  522. ‌      let s = String.Set.diff s1 s0 in
  523.       if String.Set.is_empty s then
  524.         Format.fprintf ppf "@ @[<hv2>module %s : sig%a@;<1 -2>end@]"
  525.           key (dump_map (String.Set.union s1 s0)) m'
  526.       else
  527.         Format.fprintf ppf "@ module %s = %s" key (String.Set.choose s))
  528.     m

  530. ‌let process_ml_map =
  531.   read_parse_and_extract Parse.implementation Depend.add_implementation_binding
  532.                          String.Map.empty Pparse.Structure

  534. ‌let process_mli_map =
  535.   read_parse_and_extract Parse.interface Depend.add_signature_binding
  536.                          String.Map.empty Pparse.Signature

  538. ‌let parse_map fname =
  539.   map_files := fname :: !map_files ;
  540.   let old_transp = !Clflags.transparent_modules in
  541.   Clflags.transparent_modules := true;
  542.   let (deps, m) =
  543.     process_file fname ~def:(String.Set.empty, String.Map.empty)
  544.       ~ml_file:process_ml_map
  545.       ~mli_file:process_mli_map
  546.   in
  547.   Clflags.transparent_modules := old_transp;
  548.   let modname =
  549.     String.capitalize_ascii
  550.       (Filename.basename (Filename.chop_extension fname)) in
  551.   if String.Map.is_empty m then
  552.     report_err (Failure (fname ^ " : empty map file or parse error"));
  553.   let mm = Depend.make_node m in
  554.   if !debug then begin
  555.     Format.printf "@[<v>%s:%t%a@]@." fname
  556.       (fun ppf -> String.Set.iter (Format.fprintf ppf " %s") deps)
  557.       (dump_map deps) (String.Map.add modname mm String.Map.empty)
  558.   end;
  559.   let mm = Depend.(weaken_map (String.Set.singleton modname) mm) in
  560.   module_map := String.Map.add modname mm !module_map

  562. (* Dependency processing *)

  564. ‌type dep_arg =
  565.   | Map of Misc.filepath (* -map option *)
  566.   | Src of Misc.filepath * file_kind option (* -impl, -intf or anon arg *)

  568. ‌let process_dep_arg = function
  569.   | Map file -> parse_map file
  570.   | Src (file, None) -> file_dependencies file
  571.   | Src (file, (Some file_kind)) -> file_dependencies_as file_kind file

  573. ‌let process_dep_args dep_args = List.iter process_dep_arg dep_args

  575. (* Entry point *)

  577. ‌let print_version () =
  578.   Format.printf "ocamldep, version %s@." Sys.ocaml_version;
  579.   exit 0

  581. ‌let print_version_num () =
  582.   Format.printf "%s@." Sys.ocaml_version;
  583.   exit 0


  586. ‌let run_main argv =
  587.   let dep_args_rev : dep_arg list ref = ref [] in
  588.   let add_dep_arg f s = dep_args_rev := (f s) :: !dep_args_rev in
  589.   Clflags.classic := false;
  590.   try
  591.     Compenv.readenv ppf Before_args;
  592.     Clflags.reset_arguments (); (* reset arguments from ocamlc/ocamlopt *)
  593.     Clflags.add_arguments __LOC__ [
  594.       "-absname", Arg.Set Clflags.absname,
  595.         " Show absolute filenames in error messages";
  596.       "-no-absname", Arg.Clear Clflags.absname,
  597.         " Do not try to show absolute filenames in error messages (default)";
  598.       "-all", Arg.Set all_dependencies,
  599.         " Generate dependencies on all files";
  600.       "-allow-approx", Arg.Set allow_approximation,
  601.         " Fallback to a lexer-based approximation on unparsable files";
  602.       "-as-map", Arg.Set Clflags.transparent_modules,
  603.         " Omit delayed dependencies for module aliases (-no-alias-deps -w -49)";
  604.         (* "compiler uses -no-alias-deps, and no module is coerced"; *)
  605.       "-debug-map", Arg.Set debug,
  606.         " Dump the delayed dependency map for each map file";
  607.       "-I", Arg.String (add_to_list Clflags.include_dirs),
  608.         "<dir>  Add <dir> to the list of include directories";
  609.       "-nocwd", Arg.Set nocwd,
  610.         " Do not add current working directory to \
  611.           the list of include directories";
  612.       "-impl", Arg.String (add_dep_arg (fun f -> Src (f, Some ML))),
  613.         "<f>  Process <f> as a .ml file";
  614.       "-intf", Arg.String (add_dep_arg (fun f -> Src (f, Some MLI))),
  615.         "<f>  Process <f> as a .mli file";
  616.       "-map", Arg.String (add_dep_arg (fun f -> Map f)),
  617.         "<f>  Read <f> and propagate delayed dependencies to following files";
  618.       "-ml-synonym", Arg.String(add_to_synonym_list ml_synonyms),
  619.         "<e>  Consider <e> as a synonym of the .ml extension";
  620.       "-mli-synonym", Arg.String(add_to_synonym_list mli_synonyms),
  621.         "<e>  Consider <e> as a synonym of the .mli extension";
  622.       "-modules", Arg.Set raw_dependencies,
  623.         " Print module dependencies in raw form (not suitable for make)";
  624.       "-native", Arg.Set native_only,
  625.         " Generate dependencies for native-code only (no .cmo files)";
  626.       "-bytecode", Arg.Set bytecode_only,
  627.         " Generate dependencies for bytecode-code only (no .cmx files)";
  628.       "-one-line", Arg.Set one_line,
  629.         " Output one line per file, regardless of the length";
  630.       "-open", Arg.String (add_to_list Clflags.open_modules),
  631.         "<module>  Opens the module <module> before typing";
  632.       "-plugin", Arg.String(fun _p -> Clflags.plugin := true),
  633.         "<plugin>  (no longer supported)";
  634.       "-pp", Arg.String(fun s -> Clflags.preprocessor := Some s),
  635.         "<cmd>  Pipe sources through preprocessor <cmd>";
  636.       "-ppx", Arg.String (add_to_list Compenv.first_ppx),
  637.         "<cmd>  Pipe abstract syntax trees through preprocessor <cmd>";
  638.       "-shared", Arg.Set shared,
  639.         " Generate dependencies for native plugin files (.cmxs targets)";
  640.       "-slash", Arg.Set Clflags.force_slash,
  641.         " (Windows) Use forward slash / instead of backslash \\ in file paths";
  642.       "-no-slash", Arg.Clear Clflags.force_slash,
  643.         " (Windows) Preserve any backslash \\ in file paths";
  644.       "-sort", Arg.Set sort_files,
  645.         " Sort files according to their dependencies";
  646.       "-version", Arg.Unit print_version,
  647.         " Print version and exit";
  648.       "-vnum", Arg.Unit print_version_num,
  649.         " Print version number and exit";
  650.       "-args", Arg.Expand Arg.read_arg,
  651.         "<file> Read additional newline separated command line arguments \n\
  652.         \      from <file>";
  653.       "-args0", Arg.Expand Arg.read_arg0,
  654.         "<file> Read additional NUL separated command line arguments from \n\
  655.         \      <file>"
  656.     ];
  657.     let program = Filename.basename Sys.argv.(0) in
  658.     Compenv.parse_arguments (ref argv)
  659.       (add_dep_arg (fun f -> Src (f, None))) program;
  660.     process_dep_args (List.rev !dep_args_rev);
  661.     Compenv.readenv ppf Before_link;
  662.     if !sort_files then sort_files_by_dependencies !files
  663.     else List.iter print_file_dependencies (List.sort compare !files);
  664.     (if Error_occurred.get () then 2 else 0)
  665.   with
  666.   | Compenv.Exit_with_status n ->
  667.       n
  668.   | exn ->
  669.       Location.report_exception ppf exn;
  670.       2


  673. ‌let main () =
  674.   exit (run_main Sys.argv)

  676. ‌let main_from_option () =
  677.   if Sys.argv.(1) <> "-depend" then begin
  678.     Printf.eprintf
  679.       "Fatal error: argument -depend must be used as first argument.\n%!";
  680.     exit 2;
  681.   end;
  682.   let args =
  683.     Array.concat [ [| Sys.argv.(0) ^ " -depend" |];
  684.                    Array.sub Sys.argv 2 (Array.length Sys.argv - 2) ] in
  685.   Sys.argv.(0) <- args.(0);
  686.   exit (run_main args)
